news.title: WeWork IPO receives 4% subscription on Day 1
news.para: WeWork India's initial public offering received a 4% subscription on its first day, with retail investors at 14% and institutional buyers at 2%. The Rs 3,000-crore offer for sale, valued at Rs 8,685 crore, will conclude on October 7, with proceeds going to selling shareholders like Embassy Buildcon and WeWork Global.

news.title: Trichy civic body raises water, UGD charges based on built-up area of residential properties
news.para: Trichy corporation has revised drinking water and UGD charges, now based on property built-up area. This led to an 11-100% increase in water charges and over 60% for UGD, sparking resident concerns over potential rent hikes. The revision, stipulated by funding agencies for loans, awaits an implementation decision.

news.title: Nagpur civic body auctions properties, attaches assets to recover tax dues
news.para: Nagpur Municipal Corporation launched a major crackdown on property tax defaulters, conducting auctions and asset attachments across Lakadganj and Laxmi Nagar zones. In Lakadganj, five properties worth Rs1.66 crore were auctioned, while five owners paid Rs10.45 lakh directly. NMC also attached assets of M/s Premier Technology Pvt Ltd for Rs13.

news.title: Citizens’ group opposes plan to slash buffer zone around lakes in Bengaluru
news.para: City-based organisation submits memorandum to urban development dept highlighting potential environmental damage, urges state government to expand, rather than shrink existing buffer areas

news.title: Chandigarh becomes India's first slum-free city with razing of Shahpur Colony
news.para: Chandigarh has achieved the distinction of becoming India's first slum-free city after the demolition of Shahpur Colony, its last remaining slum. The administration successfully cleared 18 slum colonies, reclaiming valuable government land and rehabilitating eligible families under the Chandigarh Small Flats Scheme, 2006. This milestone sets a new benchmark for urban renewal and inclusive development.

news.title: Bids for IT Park 4 in Indore to be invited this month
news.para: The Madhya Pradesh Industrial Development Corporation will invite bids in October for 70,000 sq ft of office space in the new IT Park 4. Nearing completion, this park aims to attract tech, ESDM, and data center investments with 30-year leases. MPIDC also plans phased allocations for IT Park 3 in 2026, transforming Indore into a major innovation hub.

news.title: Mumbai sees 20% rise in property registrations this Navratri
news.para: Mumbai recorded 6,238 property registrations during Navratri 2025, a 20% year-on-year increase, contributing Rs 587 crore to state revenue. This surge, driven by an earlier festive calendar, stable interest rates, and improved affordability, made September 2025 the city's best in a decade for registrations, reflecting strong buyer confidence.

news.title: Registration of housing schemes in Lucknow begins today
news.para: Lucknow Development Authority opened online registration for flats in Sardar Vallabh Bhai Patel and Atal Nagar housing schemes, targeting low-and-middle-income residents until November 3. The schemes offer 72 EWS flats in Dalibagh and 2,496 units in Devpur Para, with prices starting from Rs 9.82 lakh, featuring essential amenities and transparent lottery allotment.

news.title: Lakes in Hyderabad shrunk by 500% in two decades of real estate boom
news.para: Hyderabad's water bodies shrank by 500% between 2000 and 2020, while built-up areas doubled. This rapid urbanization, fueled by IT expansion, caused acute water shortages and alarmingly low groundwater. Experts advocate for green infrastructure and sustainable land-use policies to address the crisis.

news.title: Home sales in Toronto rise to eight-month high in September 2025
news.para: Greater Toronto Area home sales reached an eight-month high in September, increasing 2% month-over-month, while prices continued their decline, falling 0.5%. Despite improved sales, levels remain below normal. Further interest rate cuts by the Bank of Canada are anticipated to boost the market, following last month's benchmark rate reduction.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh RERA lodges FIR against A.S.G.I. Properties
news.para: UP-RERA has lodged an FIR against A.S.G.I. Properties for fraud and forgery, alleging the promoter used a fabricated order to mislead allottees and secure fraudulent bank loans for its Apple Tower project. Investigations confirmed no such order was issued by UP-RERA, with a buyers' association also complaining about the deception.

news.title: Thane civic body bribery case: Third accused surrenders before ACB officials
news.para: Sushant Surve, an accused in the Thane Municipal Corporation bribery case, surrendered to the Anti-Corruption Bureau. A local court remanded him in police custody until October 6. Deputy Municipal Commissioner Shankar Patole and Omkar Gaikar were arrested earlier. They faced charges for demanding a 50 lakh rupee bribe from a real estate developer.

news.title: Eldeco Infrastructure files DRHP for IPO to raise ₹1,000 crore
news.para: Eldeco Infrastructure and Properties has filed its DRHP for an IPO, aiming to raise ₹1,000 crore through an ₹800 crore fresh issue and a ₹200 crore offer-for-sale by promoters. A significant portion of the fresh issue proceeds will repay a subsidiary's debt. The company, which saw its revenue nearly triple in fiscal 2025, has 19 ongoing and 18 forthcoming projects.

news.title: Income tax department slaps ₹23 crore fine on Adani Cement entity ACC
news.para: The Income Tax department has imposed two separate fines totaling Rs 23.07 crore on ACC Ltd, an Adani Group firm. These penalties, for "inaccurate particulars of income" (AY 2015-16) and "under-reporting of income" (AY 2018-19), will be contested by ACC before appellate authorities. The company stated these demands, from before Adani's acquisition, will not impact its financial activity.

news.title: Property prices dampen Dussehra sales in Ahmedabad
news.para: Ahmedabad's real estate market experienced a sluggish Dussehra, marking its weakest festive season since Covid, attributed to oversupply and soaring property prices. Buyers are now opting for affordable, ready-to-move homes to avoid project delays. CREDAI Gujarat remains optimistic, anticipating a revival driven by GST cuts, lower interest rates, and the potential for Ahmedabad to host the Commonwealth Games.

news.title: Tripunithura municipality begins tender process for two malls
news.para: Tripunithura municipal council has initiated new tender procedures for two long-unused malls, built over five years ago at a cost of Rs 18.5 crore. After repeated failed attempts to lease them due to the pandemic and economic slowdown, the council reclassified the properties as commercial buildings. This move aims to make them operational soon and recover significant revenue losses.

news.title: Developers who plant trees in Gurugram's Matri Van will earn green credits
news.para: Developers will now earn green credits for planting trees in Gurugram's Matri Van. This initiative aims to boost green cover in the Aravalis. Environmentalists express concerns about the policy. They fear it could compromise ecological integrity. Critics suggest it may lead to land capture. Experts advocate for natural regeneration over token plantations. The Green Credit Programme faces scrutiny.

news.title: Thane deputy municipal commissioner, aide arrested for ‘accepting’ bribe from developer
news.para: Thane Municipal Corporation deputy commissioner Shankar Patole and Omkar Gaikar were arrested by the ACB for allegedly accepting a bribe from a developer to clear encroachments. They were caught red-handed in Patole's office and remanded to custody until October 4. This incident has fueled political speculation and renewed concerns about deep-rooted corruption within the TMC.

news.title: Unified policy, airport budget on table as Noida authority board set to meet on Oct 3
news.para: Noida Authority's board meeting on Friday will discuss key amendments to the Unified Policy, aiming to standardize land norms across Noida, Greater Noida, and YEIDA for improved efficiency. Proposals also include a 300 TDP integrated waste management plant to generate electricity and fertilizer, alongside budget allocation for Noida International Airport.

news.title: Property tax amnesty extended till Oct-end in Sambhajinagar
news.para: Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar Municipal Corporation has extended its property tax amnesty scheme until October-end, now offering a 50% discount on penalty charges. This popular scheme, which previously offered higher waivers and recovered Rs 100 crore, aims to encourage citizens to clear dues before a rigorous collection drive begins.
